abstract.p: Off-duty New York City Police Detective Robert Lopez is suspended for firing shot at gunman who was confronting another man in street (S)

block.p: An off-duty police detective fired a single shot from his fifth-floor apartment window at a gunman who was confronting another man in the street and who had ignored the detective's order to drop the gun, officials said.
The detective, Robert Lopez, was suspended for discharging his firearm in a reckless manner, the police said.

An off-duty police detective fired a single shot from his fifth-floor apartment window at a gunman who was confronting another man in the street and who had ignored the detective's order to drop the gun, officials said.
The detective, Robert Lopez, was suspended for discharging his firearm in a reckless manner, the police said.
Because the incident occurred at the officer's apartment building, the police would not provide the address.

Detective Lopez said he saw a group of men in front of his building late Friday night, one of them with a gun, the police said. The detective yelled from the window, ordering the man to drop the weapon, the police said.
When the man refused to drop the gun, Detective Lopez fired a single shot, dispersing the group, the police said.
One of the men, Andre Tull, 25, of 2304 Sedgwick Avenue, was arrested a few blocks away and charged with possession of a weapon and menacing, although no gun was found, the police said.
Detective Lopez is assigned to the 106th Precinct detective squad, which covers Ozone Park and Howard Beach, Queens.
